runs.comm: poked at from the crease on off stump, thick outside edge down to third man
crunching drive, half-saved at extra-cover, absolutely nailed that Gayle
full on the stump, blocked up to mid-on
forward press from off stump into a gap between extra-cover and mid-off
back of a length at the body, tucked down to square leg
length ball swings back a little and strikes the pad, huge cry for lbw, not out, probably just outside the line, maybe high too
bit of a hack from just outside off, thick inside edge down to long leg
full sliding across the left hander, slides away a little, beats him
length on a much straighter line, tucked into mid-on
bumper, hooked at and misses, it bounces very high and over the keeper
full just outside off and crunched over long-on, trademark Gayle, big whack, in the slot for him really, such a clean strike
step to leg and this time takes a length ball over straight midwicket, absolutely creamed it once again
length on a middle and off line, knocked back up the wicket
touch straight and steered past short long leg with a roll of the wrists
bumper, it gets up just enough and Smith ducks
fuller angled in, blocked into the covers
swept around the corner again, can't be too straight to Smith
a step down the wicket, frees the arms and strokes a length ball over long-off, superb, the timing perfect once more
full angled at the pads, Smith misses aiming a flick leg side
finds the gap at midwicket with a little push forward
low full toss on off stump, Gayle was aiming leg side but gets a thick outside edge past backward point
moves to the leg side, the bowler tries to follow him but to no avail, blasted away from middle and leg over long-off
whacks it leg side this time, clean as a whistle, it screams past mid-on
short ball, Gayle tries to whack it somewhere and gets a bit of a top edge into the off side, cover charges back and dives but can't get there
full on the pad, pushed back to the bowler
length ball a foot wide of off stump, Smith stays leg side of it and blasts it past mid-off, great timing, fifty up already
tightens the line and this is just blocked
touch shorter and Smith farms it over midwicket, stand and whack, that's how you earn your money in this format
wide outside off, Smith can only find point
fuller and much straighter, clipped to the left of short long leg and Tahir dives to save well
full on the off stump, driven at, it swings in to take a thick inside edge that runs very fine, lucky for the batsman
wider line and angled out to third man
length outside off, pulled hard over mid-on, more of a club this time but still enough meat
length ball again, Gayle steps to the leg side and boshes it straight down the ground, well into the stand, timed that much better
tighter line and pulled behind square, four more, just used the pace this time, one bounce over the rope
full and wide of off stump, driven at and gets it over point into the fence, fifty in JUST 17 BALLS! The fastest fifty for West Indies

full, Smith goes for a reverse paddle sweep, misses and is given out lbw! South Africa desperately needed that. Went for something extravagant first ball, made a mistake and was caught in front of off stump. But it looks as if Smith did glove it onto his pad
back across the off stump, dropping this out to point
this slips down the leg side
flicks this past square leg and they are able to get back for a second
driven to extra-cover, well saved by the fielder going to his left
just covering this up on the stumps
straighter line, tucked straight to midwicket
controlled drive past extra-cover, long-off around to field
hint of width and angled down to third man
full ball at the off stump, Gayle stays leg side of it and drives out to deep cover
length at the middle and leg stumps, knocked back up the wicket
decent bumper, well ducked
fuller and wider and worked down to third man again
tossed up wide of off stump, thick inside edge backward of square on the leg side
tossed a long way up, very full on middle and leg, knocked back to the bowler
quicker ball with Gayle right back on his stumps, clipped through square leg
full and straight, clipped out through midwicket
some width outside off gives Gayle the chance to blast it down the ground, like a rocket, flat, inside long-off
lines up a big slog sweep this time but mistimes it out to deep cover
length on the stumps, tucked up slightly, nudged back to the bowler
steps away to leg, the bowler follows him and goes slower too, Gayle mistimes a pull out to midwicket
full on the stumps, this is flicked out through square leg
full delivery a foot or so outside off, nicely stroked out to long-off
nice shot, back of a length, Smith steps away to leg and uppercuts over backward point, really good that
shorter, Samuels looked for another uppercut but missed this time
around the wicket, slider outside off beats Gayle's outside edge
fuller ball, smashed down the ground, has he got enough on this, Miller very interested at long-off but he's leaping over the boundary because Gayle has got just enough club on this
slog sweep this time and it rifles over the midwicket fence, flat and so hard, look out on the banks
googly and it spins away from the attempt smash over the leg side

well outside off, Gayle tries to reverse sweep it and gets a little glove to the keeper! Tahir charges off in celebration and a fabulous innings comes to an end. Cute isn't Gayle's game, he tried to really take the micky out of Tahir and got a little glove on the reverse sweep that was well held by the keeper in the fingertips
full on the stumps, pressed down to long-on
back across the stumps flicking this out through square leg to the man in the deep
full delivery just outside off, tried to be square driven but missed, wasn't too far from the off stump
full at the pads, clipped down to long leg
very full on the off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
driven from off stump, bump ball to extra-cover, crowd are cheering for a catch
back of a length on off stump, Bravo up on his toes to knock it down into midwicket
length just outside off, pressed at and gets a thick outside edge past short third man
tries to late cut now and misses, similar ball
gets the cut away this time but only to short third man, they still manage to sneak a single
length on the stumps, this is clipped through midwicket
yorker, dug out down the ground
length ball, a cutter, waited for and nudged down the ground for an easy single
back of a length just outside off, press off the back foot straight to extra cover
tighter line, dropped just behind backward point
full angled in at the batsman who only rolls this back up the wicket
angled in again but a touch shorter and Samuels steers it backward to deep square
slower ball a foot outside off, driven down to long-on
fuller and straighter, clipped down to long-on
length on the stumps, tucked into midwicket
follows the batsman stepping to leg who mis-pulls just out of the reach of a diving midwicket
back of a length and straighter, dropped just into the leg side and they take a cheeky single
short ball, Samuels onto it quickly and pulls over midwicket, nice timing
more of a slap this time looking to go leg side again, big top edge that flies down towards long leg, Tahir comes in and misjudges it completely, ends up diving forward and missing the chance
back of a length wide of off stump, hammered only a few yards wide of the cover sweeper but the fielder has absolutely no chance
trying to work a full ball leg side gets a leading edge that's taken by midwicket. Trying to play a little too square really and it chipped up straight to the fielder who took the simplest of catches
full length on a straight line, this is simply tucked back up the bowler
full again, pushed down the ground for a single to long-off
bumper swayed inside as it goes over the off stump
full length on the stumps, Pollard forward pushing through midwicket
short ball, tried to be swung to leg, gets a thick underedge that whistles to the fine fine leg fence
down the wicket to a googly which beats the inside edge and strikes the pad, outside the line for  lbw
back on the stumps to a slider that's nudged through midwicket
slow leggie just tapped back to the bowler from off stump

down the wicket, playing with bat and pad together and it comes off the pad via the bat and loops to cover point. Can't say as I've seen a bat-pad catch to a fielder that far out before. Tried to kick it away but the ball ran off the outside of the pad and then the splice of the bat and looped into the infield. Tahir celebrates like he's won the world cup
covering up in front of off stump, knocks this back to the bowler
fuller, pressed down to long-on
length ball just outside off, knocked into the covers
length on the stumps, batsman clears the front leg and hammers it just past mid-on, unkind bounce didn't help
slapped down to long-on who's now back on the fence
back of a length, defended dropping it down on the popping crease
shortish again, rode down the leg side for a single to long leg

short ball pulled high into the sky, long leg comes under it and takes the catch. Solid take because that went a long way up, misjudgement from the batsman, slightly beaten for pace, top edge that went so high up and very well held
length just outside off, tried to be late cut and missed
short ball, tried to be pulled but missed, well outside off
short again, this is uppercut to third man's left
length at the stumps, tucked out to deep square
length again, just outside off, angled down to third man
bumper, pretty sharp and well ducked

short ball, hooked at, big top edge straight to long leg. Another solid catch by Abbott and again the batsman a little beaten for pace and top-edging a big attempted hook, it flew straight to the fielder
length on the stumps, Pollard whacks it into the leg side, finds the straight midwicket rope and that's the game
